013package org.apache.juneau.internal;
014
015import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ThrowableUtils.*;
016
017import java.lang.reflect.*;
018
019import org.apache.juneau.*;
020import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
021import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
022
023/**
024 * Utility class for efficiently converting objects between types.
025 *
026 * <p>
027 * If the value isn't an instance of the specified type, then converts the value if possible.
028 *
029 * <p>
030 * The following conversions are valid:
031 * <table class='styled'>
032 *    <tr><th>Convert to type</th><th>Valid input value types</th><th>Notes</th></tr>
033 *    <tr>
034 *       <td>
035 *          A class that is the normal type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
036 *       </td>
037 *       <td>
038 *          A value whose class matches the transformed type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
039 *       </td>
040 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
041 *    </tr>
042 *    <tr>
043 *       <td>
044 *          A class that is the transformed type of a registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
045 *       </td>
046 *       <td>
047 *          A value whose class matches the normal type of that registered {@link ObjectSwap}.
048 *       </td>
049 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
050 *    </tr>
051 *    <tr>
052 *       <td>
053 *          {@code Number} (e.g. {@code Integer}, {@code Short}, {@code Float},...)
054 *          <br><code>Number.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code> (e.g. <code>Integer.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,
055 *          <code>Short.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>, <code>Float.<jsf>TYPE</jsf></code>,...)
056 *       </td>
057 *       <td>
058 *          {@code Number}, {@code String}, <jk>null</jk>
059 *       </td>
060 *       <td>
061 *          For primitive {@code TYPES}, <jk>null</jk> returns the JVM default value for that type.
062 *       </td>
063 *    </tr>
064 *    <tr>
065 *       <td>
066 *          {@code Map} (e.g. {@code Map}, {@code HashMap}, {@code TreeMap}, {@code JsonMap})
067 *       </td>
068 *       <td>
069 *          {@code Map}
070 *       </td>
071 *       <td>
072 *          If {@code Map} is not constructible, an {@code JsonMap} is created.
073 *       </td>
074 *    </tr>
075 *    <tr>
076 *       <td>
077 *          <c>Collection</c> (e.g. <c>List</c>, <c>LinkedList</c>, <c>HashSet</c>, <c>JsonList</c>)
078 *       </td>
079 *       <td>
080 *          <c>Collection&lt;Object&gt;</c>
081 *          <br><c>Object[]</c>
082 *       </td>
083 *       <td>
084 *          If <c>Collection</c> is not constructible, a <c>JsonList</c> is created.
085 *       </td>
086 *    </tr>
087 *    <tr>
088 *       <td>
089 *          <c>X[]</c> (array of any type X)
090 *       </td>
091 *       <td>
092 *          <c>List&lt;X&gt;</c>
093 *       </td>
094 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
095 *    </tr>
096 *    <tr>
097 *       <td>
098 *          <c>X[][]</c> (multi-dimensional arrays)
099 *       </td>
100 *       <td>
101 *          <c>List&lt;List&lt;X&gt;&gt;</c>
102 *          <br><c>List&lt;X[]&gt;</c>
103 *          <br><c> List[]&lt;X&gt;</c>
104 *       </td>
105 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
106 *    </tr>
107 *    <tr>
108 *       <td>
109 *          <c>Enum</c>
110 *       </td>
111 *       <td>
112 *          <c>String</c>
113 *       </td>
114 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
115 *    </tr>
116 *    <tr>
117 *       <td>
118 *          Bean
119 *       </td>
120 *       <td>
121 *          <c>Map</c>
122 *       </td>
123 *       <td>&nbsp;</td>
124 *    </tr>
125 *    <tr>
126 *       <td>
127 *          <c>String</c>
128 *       </td>
129 *       <td>
130 *          Anything
131 *       </td>
132 *       <td>
133 *          Arrays are converted to JSON arrays
134 *       </td>
135 *    </tr>
136 *    <tr>
137 *       <td>
138 *          Anything with one of the following methods:
139 *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T fromString(String)</code>
140 *          <br><code><jk>public static</jk> T valueOf(String)</code>
141 *          <br><code><jk>public</jk> T(String)</code>
142 *       </td>
143 *       <td>
144 *          <c>String</c>
145 *       </td>
146 *       <td>
147 *          <br>
148 *       </td>
149 *    </tr>
150 * </table>
151 *
152 * <ul class='seealso'>
153 * </ul>
154 */
155public final class ConverterUtils {
156
157   // Session objects are usually not thread safe, but we're not using any feature
158   // of bean sessions that would cause thread safety issues.
159   private static final BeanSession session = BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION;
160
161   /**
162    * Converts the specified object to the specified type.
163    *
164    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
165    * @param value The value to convert.
166    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
167    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
168    * @return The converted value.
169    */
170   public static <T> T toType(Object value, Class<T> type) {
171      return session.convertToType(value, type);
172   }
173
174
175   /**
176    * Converts the specified object to the specified type.
177    *
178    * @param <T> The class type to convert the value to.
179    * @param value The value to convert.
180    * @param type The class type to convert the value to.
181    * @param args The type arguments.
182    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If the specified value cannot be converted to the specified type.
183    * @return The converted value.
184    */
185   public static <T> T toType(Object value, Class<T> type, Type...args) {
186      return session.convertToType(value, type, args);
187   }
188
189   /**
190    * Converts an object to a Boolean.
191    *
192    * @param o The object to convert.
193    * @return The converted object.
194    */
195   public static Boolean toBoolean(Object o) {
196      return toType(o, Boolean.class);
197   }
198
199   /**
200    * Converts an object to an Integer.
201    *
202    * @param o The object to convert.
203    * @return The converted object.
204    */
205   public static Integer toInteger(Object o) {
206      return toType(o, Integer.class);
207   }
208
209   /**
210    * Converts an object to a Number.
211    *
212    * @param o The object to convert.
213    * @return The converted object.
214    */
215   public static Number toNumber(Object o) {
216      if (o == null)
217         return null;
218      if (o instanceof Number)
219         return (Number)o;
220      try {
221         return StringUtils.parseNumber(o.toString(), null);
222      } catch (ParseException e) {
223         throw asRuntimeException(e);
224      }
225   }
226}
